doc:
Gladys Hanson https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gladys_Hanson 0 Gladys Hanson (1884–1973) was a stage and silent film actress. Hanson began her career on the Broadway stage in 1907 with the Charles Frohman Company. On the stage she played in the theatrical productions Our American Cousin (1908) with Edward Hugh Sothern, The Builder of Bridge (1909) with later film star Eugene O'Brien and The Governor's Lady (1912) with Emma Dunn and future film leading man Milton Sills. In 1914 she began working in film for Famous Players and later worked for Universal and Essanay. Her last film appearance was Walls Tell Tales in 1928.She married Charles Emerson Cook but they later divorced. They had one child, Gladys-Irene Cook. Gladys_Hanson ( 1884 – 1973 ) was a_stage and silent_film_actress . Hanson began her_career on the_Broadway_stage in 1907 with the_Charles_Frohman_Company . On the_stage she played in the_theatrical_productions Our_American_Cousin_(_1908_) with Edward_Hugh_Sothern , The_Builder of Bridge_(_1909_) with later_film_star_Eugene_O'Brien and The_Governor 's_Lady_(_1912_) with Emma_Dunn and future_film_leading_man Milton_Sills . In 1914 she began_working in film for Famous_Players and later_worked for Universal_and_Essanay . Her_last_film_appearance was Walls_Tell_Tales in 1928 . She married Charles_Emerson_Cook but they later divorced . They had one_child , Gladys-Irene_Cook .
